oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis of capped nanosized Mn1-xZnxFe2O4 (0 <= x <= 0.8) by microwave refluxing for bio-medical applications
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GIRI, J
SRIHARSHA, T
ASTHANA, S
RAO, TKG
NIGAM, AK
BAHADUR, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: organic-synthesis
zinc ferrites
nanoparticles
ovens
nanoparticles
microwave refluxing
mnzn-ferrites
bioapplication
liposome
preparation method
pegylation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Substituted ferrites [Mn1-xZnxFe2O4 (0 <= x <= 0.8)] of nanoscale dimensions have been prepared by a novel microwave refluxing method. The effect of different parameters [such as pH, reflux time, presence of PEG (MW-3350) molecules] on particle morphology and size has been studied. Characterization of the above capped particles was done by XRD, FTIR, TEM and SQUID magnetometry. The as-prepared particles were further used for magnetoliposome preparation. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS,293(1)55-61
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 5th International Conference on Scientific and Clinical Applications of Magnetic Carriers,Lyon, FRANCE,MAY 20-22, 2004
